intro: Spergula pentandra var. minor, commonly known as lesser spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are narrow and opposite, often covered in fine hairs, and the plant is typically found in moist, disturbed soils. It is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid spread and resilience. The species is adapted to temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
